message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you the chance to purchase this product.  I believe it would be incredibly valuable to your operations, even more so than my own.  Given its potential, I'm proposing an initial offer of $1,100,000.  What are your thoughts?
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value you see in the product. My budget allows me to spend up to $1,000,000 on this purchase. Would you consider adjusting your offer accordingly?

Bob, thanks for your counteroffer. I understand your budget constraints, but I'm confident this product will bring you much more value than $1,000,000 in the long run. How about we meet in the middle at $1,050,000? It's a fair price that reflects its true worth.

I've given this some thought, Alice. While I understand the value you place on the product, I still feel that $1,000,000 is the maximum I can realistically allocate for this purchase. Can we meet somewhere closer to this figure?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and understand you have a limit. To be fair, I also have a bottom line. Would you be willing to consider $1,025,000? This would be a win-win, allowing me to feel good about the deal while still giving you a significant return on your investment.
Alice, thank you for your offer. I've reviewed our previous discussions and am willing to increase my offer to $987,500. I believe this is a fair compromise that respects both our interests.
